answers.answer: Hi,How is your brother? It is good that the initial diagnostic test results were fine. However, further evaluation may need to be done especially if the symptoms persist. A referral to a specialist may also be beneficial.  The headache may  also be caused by primary headaches such as migraine or one of its variants, hemiplegic migraine. This usually presents with normal imaging studies as well as symptoms like headache, numbness, dizziness, paralysis, visual aura and language difficulties. Hope this helps. Take care and do keep us posted.

question: My brother has diabetes, high blood pressure, hepatitis c, and i think IBD? anyways, he has been having these headaches that get so bad that he sees a bright light cause they are that painful for him. Then he gets dizzy and faints, his blood pressure keeps dropping and his blood sugar rises, he's been in the hospital for 4 days now and the doctors can't seem to figure out what is wrong with him. They have run tests on his colon, they have done xrays, and ultrasounds and can't find anything.
title: Really worried about my brother Please Help!!!
